results.title: Operations Manager, Development
results.description:
Seeking a superstar systems enthusiast to lead on managing data systems, processes, and special initiatives for a team of equally superstar fundraisers. 

 

About the Position

Namati’s Development team has a strong track record of success, including a healthy number of long-time supporters, and significant recent wins enabling organizational growth and long-term sustainability. We are building a dynamic team of seasoned fundraisers to drive the continued revenue growth of Namati. The Operations Manager will be a central player on the team. This leader will manage information systems and processes to allow the teammates to work independently and effectively, while being efficient and coordinated across the organization. 

We seek a teammate who genuinely enjoys, and has demonstrable experience working on, the operations and administrative side of an organization or company. You feel satisfaction when you bring both precision and creative thinking to operational roles. You understand that “behind-the-scenes” work is critical to the achievement of any important mission. Fundraising experience is strongly preferred, but not required for the right candidate.

Our ideal candidate is an impeccably organized, creative, and confident team player. This person should possess exemplary process management and communication skills, outstanding attention to detail, drive to excel in all responsibilities, and capacity to grow in response to the needs of our growing team and organizational budget.

The Operations Manager will report to the Director of Development. Responsibilities include:

Operations

Manage all operational aspects of the Development team. For instance: 

  • Track proposals and reporting processes, collaborating with relevant team members to ensure impeccable, timely submissions.
  • Understand, manage, and improve our existing CRM system (Hubspot).
  • Oversee all shared projects in our project management software Asana, and help the team use the system optimally in  their own workflows. 
  • In partnership with the Director of Development, manage the fundraising forecasting system -- ensure that the forecasting chart is populated with accurate and up-to-date information, for use by both Development and Finance teams.
  • Maintain individual donor gifts processing and stewardship systems.
  • Oversee knowledge management, including filing and tracking all relevant internal and external materials in Google Drive.


Donor cultivation and stewardship: 

  • Manage email communications with funders via Hubspot
  • Research prospective donors and provide strategic recommendations on whether/how to approach the donors 
  • Keep abreast of funding trends to help Namati build and maintain a healthy funding pipeline.
  • Develop and execute creative initiatives to deepen ties with current and prospective donors 
  • Lead Namati’s year-end fundraising campaign  
  • Support and prepare the Director of Development and the Senior Manager of Development for funder meetings.

Here’s what you might have tackled in the past week:

  • Managed communications across several teams to ensure a timely submission for a foundation funder, paying careful attention to all reporting requirements.
  • Scheduled a kick-off call with teammates across multiple time zones for a large submission to a new government funder;  developed a detailed checklist for elements to include in the proposal,  ensured that each element has an owner, communicated any questions to the funder, and carefully read the fine print to confirm our eligibility.
  • Reviewed several online databases for new funding opportunities, flagging any promising opportunities for the Development Director.
  • Track recent donations in Hubspot and ensure that the donor receives a prompt response. 
  • Sent reminders to teammates about several reporting deadlines coming up in the next 30 days, and built a plan to make sure each team will have what they need to complete these reports.
  • Organized a virtual film screening for donors, followed by a dynamic and informative discussion between prospective donors and Namati program leads 

 

About You

  • Organized and an exceptional project manager: You know how to bring together geographically dispersed colleagues at varying levels of seniority (often with competing deadlines and priorities) to get things done. You can monitor all the details across multiple projects while ensuring the larger strategic plan is on track.
  • Exceptional communication skills: Your written and verbal communications evidence clarity of thought, sharpness of analysis, and you’re able to tailor your communications to meet people where they are.
  • Technologically-savvy: You’re a technophile; when working with a new program or application you quickly become fluent. You understand the stakes of securing our data and will do what it takes to protect and optimize it. You have (likely 2+ years) experience managing complex relational databases. Even better if you have experience with Hubspot.
  • Collaborative and service-oriented: You greet everyone you encounter with a collaborative spirit, kindness, and empathy. You like helping the team and serving our communities. 
  • Growth mindset: You’re always seeking to better yourself and your work, and you will push yourself to the peak of performance to help fulfill our mission. In service of that growth, you welcome and delight in feedback from supervisors, peers, reports, and anyone else

 

Location 

This position is remote (partially remote if based in/near Washington, DC) and open to any location in the United States. Please note that candidates must already be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered for the role.

Compensation & benefits
Throughout the hiring process we will seek to understand your specific skills, experience, and abilities as they will fit into our team and our job levels. The offer range for this position is likely to fall between $75,000 - $85,000 based on the final job level determined by the responsibility, scope, and complexity of the position. If you have salary requirements, please note them in your cover letter.

Namati offers an excellent benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance- Namati pays 80% of the base plan premium for individuals, and 50% for dependents
  • 3 weeks' paid vacation, 12 sick days, 12 federal holidays (plus the week between Christmas and New Years), 3 personal days, 6 weeks' parental leave
  • 401(k)- Namati contributes 5% of your salary plus matches your contribution up to an additional 5%
  • Pre-tax withholding for transportation and parking (Washington DC metro area)
  • Access to professional development opportunities


To Apply

Please complete our online application, including a resume and short application question. In the application, please submit a 200 word response to one of the application questions. No phone calls, please. Namati is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 

We'll accept applications until Friday, November 11, 2022. 

-----

Namati’s work has been featured in/on Democracy Journal, Amanpour & Co. New York Times, the Guardian, Devex, WIRED, the Washington Post, among others, and has been documented by the Sundance Institute. Vivek Maru, Namati’s CEO, gave a TED Talk in 2017 which has been viewed over 1.3 million times. In 2016, Namati was honored with the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship and in 2017, the Schwab Foundation named Vivek Maru and colleague Sonkita Conteh two of its Social Entrepreneurs of the Year. Namati has a perfect score, 100/100, on Charity Navigator and has earned Guidestar’s Platinum Seal of Transparency.

results.title: Business Operations Manager
results.description:
About Apollo

Founded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 20,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises. Our platform unifies a database of 250m contacts and 60 million business accounts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale. We're also ranked #1 in Satisfaction on G2 Crowd for Sales Intelligence & Sales Engagement and are used by 1M professionals worldwide.

In the last year, we’ve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability, and closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia Capital in March of 2022 to fuel the next phase of our growth. 

Working at Apollo

We are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence.  Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward.

Role & Team:

The mission of Apollo’s Business Operations team is to bring data insight, operational capability and strategic vision to drive growth and product strategy at Apollo. We partner with the executive team to define Apollo's business strategy, drive cross-functional projects and unlock new growth opportunities. Our team provides strategic perspectives and analytical horsepower to solve critical business strategy, optimization, and operations problems across the organization. 

We are a team of individuals with complementary skill sets. You will work collaboratively across Go-To-Market, Product, Finance and Marketing teams on a variety of strategic initiatives with a direct and quantifiable impact to our P&L. You will identify actionable insights, assess their impact, and lead execution & implementation. As one of the first members of the Business Operations team, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of the function and the overall business.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with key stakeholders across product, marketing, sales, and customer experience to drive product and business strategy by synthesizing insights and setting actionable plans.
  • Drive high-impact cross-functional initiatives such as pricing strategy, strategic investments and geographic expansion.
  • Leverage your business background to design and implement strong systems, processes and company rituals that will drive performance and collaboration throughout the organization.
  • Drive annual and quarterly business and OKR planning cycles with the leadership team to ensure Apollo is focusing and actioning on the most important near-term and long-term priorities.
  • Partner with the leadership team to define and iterate upon Apollo’s vision, mission and product strategy and conduct the requisite market, product and competitive analysis for these critical initiatives. 

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in highly strategic, operational, and analytical environments e.g. business operations, product management, investment banking, strategy consulting, private equity or venture capital.
  • Ability to solve complex business problems, think from first principles, and build scalable processes.
  • Strong analytical skills, including fluency with Microsoft Excel and BI tools like Looker, Tableau, and/or Amplitude. Knowledge of SQL is strongly preferred but not required. 
  • Experience in efficient and rigorous analysis, research and insight generation, and building hypotheses and an action plan. 
  • Proven track record of building strong collaborative relationships with teammates from a variety of backgrounds, geographies and disciplines.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What You’ll Love About Apollo

Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
We’re on a mission to improve health through nutrition. 

At Simple, we are working on improving health through nutrition, because we believe that this is how we can have the biggest impact on the world. Evidence for the links between health behaviors and later disease and ill-health is strong. Effective interventions will enable people to live longer and healthier lives, and Simple is tasked with making this a reality.

Simple is a mobile application that helps people to improve their nutritional habits through various interventions. It combines personalized programs with meal tracking and health insights -- unlocking the path to healthier and happier lives. Launched in 2019, we rapidly grew to a 15M user base and a 100%+ YoY revenue growth. Now moving to a bigger market, we need to find an engineering leader who will help us to build the best product on the market in a rapid-growth company.

We are proud of our people. We believe that the Simple team is the key to our success and the company’s most valuable asset. So, if you are interested in health and wellness, enjoy solving challenging problems, and have always aspired to become part of a global project —  we want to hear from you!

As a Chief of Staff, you will be the CEO’s right-hand person and force multiplier in many instances. Have a significant impact on the efficiency and productivity of the company.

Reporting directly to the CEO. 

Build a healthier world with us!

 

What you’ll do:
  • Be an extension of the CEO;
  • Oversee and manage internal operations: prepare agendas, take notes, and assign action items at weekly meetings; manage the OKR and annual planning processes, support with board meeting prep, manage All Hands meetings;
  • Improves our management system and rolls out changes across the company;
  • Manage CEO’s time allocation closely to ensure it is spent on the top priorities for the company;
  • Partner with Product, Finance, Pricing, and Analytics to prepare analytical and financial reports and metric dashboards;
  • Manage high-priority cross-functional initiatives, ad-hoc support, or longer-term special projects (examples – culture, decision-making frameworks, organizational design);
  • Keep the CEO accountable for commitments while helping keep reports accountable for results;

What we look for:
  • Top management consulting experience or 5+ years of experience at a high-growth tech company preferred;
  • Familiar with current productivity tools (Jira, Asana, Slack, etc);
  • Highly organized, excellent communicator (both written and verbal);
  • Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across departments, as well as an influence at all levels of the organization;
  • Experience with data analysis, budget management, operations management;
  • Proven track record setting up and scaling different processes within a high-growth environment;
  • Strategic thinking, as well as a willingness to lead initiatives through implementation
  • Strong ownership mentality;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Fluency in English;

 

Why you might be excited about us:
  • You will help build a product that improves people’s health & lives through nutrition;
  • You will have a unique perspective across the company. This includes things like joining board meetings, executive staff meetings, and supporting the vision, and strategy setting for the company;
  • Being a chief of staff is a way to accelerate your career growth as you’re shadowing the founder & CEO directly;
  • Incredible insights into the different functions — product, marketing, growth, operations— of a fast-growing tech company and how they all work together;
  • Remote, with occasional business trips (roughly 10% of the time);
  • A competitive salary package based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the business;
  • A stock option plan for every employee. When Simple does well, everyone benefits;
  • Top technical equipment, health insurance, relocation program, friendly and highly qualified colleagues, healthy snacks in our office’s kitchen (if you are in Cyprus, London).

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Our Mission

We uplift people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship.

To know more about 500 Latin America, click here.

Who We Are

500 Global is a venture capital firm with $2.7B in assets under management that invests in founders building fast-growing technology companies. We focus on markets where technology, innovation, and capital can unlock long-term value and drive economic growth. We work closely with key stakeholders and advise governments and corporations on how best to support entrepreneurial ecosystems so startups can thrive.

500 Global has backed over 5,000 founders representing more than 2,600 companies operating in 81 countries. We have invested in 51 companies valued at over $1 billion and 140+ companies valued at over $100 million (including private, public, and exited companies). Our 140+ plus team members are located in more than 20 countries and bring experience as entrepreneurs, investors, and operators from some of the world’s leading technology companies.

What We Need

The Chief of Staff for 500 Latin America (“CoS”) will be working with the Firm’s Managing Partner based in Latin America to facilitate the execution of strategic priorities, through relationship building, communications, project management, and problem-solving,

This person will serve as the right hand to the Managing Partner for their most important priorities, including the day-to-day operations of various regions, business units, and special projects, working closely with the Product and Portfolio Value teams to help them lead cross-functional projects.

The CoS will act as a strategist, consultant, and implementer, to ensure streamlined activities across Latin America and globally. They will contribute to the long-term success of the Firm by focusing on scaling operational infrastructure, as well as our expansion into new markets and products by seamlessly moving between strategic and tactical roadmaps.

We work at an incredible pace, so this person will need to be a self-starter with excellent EQ, written, verbal, and visual communication skills, strong time management skills, uncanny attention to detail, the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment, and above all, flexibility and discretion. This role may require non-standard working hours across multiple time zones and significant travel.

This position will be remote, although candidates already based in Mexico would be preferred for time zone coverage.

Who You Are

You share our passion for uplifting people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship. You thrive in entrepreneurial, creative, fast-paced environments managing multiple time zones and working with people around the world from different backgrounds and cultures. You have exceptional communication skills, organizational skills, keen attention to detail and a strong ability to manage relationships and projects, start-to-end. You gain energy from managing a wide variety of tasks and can change focus quickly as our industry and business needs change. You bring boundless positivity and energy to any workplace you work in.

What You Will Be Doing

Overall, the role is expected to be fluid and the candidate needs to be flexible, working alongside the shifting needs of the Firm. However, expected duties and responsibilities will include the following:

  • Act as an advisor to the Managing Partner assisting in facilitating effective decision-making and implementation, and working on projects and strategies.
  • Develop, manage and implement successful and consistent operational processes, systems, tools, playbooks, solutions and programs to make functions and projects more effective.
  • Coordinate and project manage the execution of assigned strategic initiatives, with specific responsibility for cross-functional delivery of key projects, ensuring smooth collaboration across multiple geographies and teams, tracking performance and successful completion of short and long-term goals reporting back to the Managing Partner on progress, blockers and risks.
  • Act as the communication arm for the Managing Partner with team members, clients, investors, community members and other stakeholders.
  • Organize and gather information from various departments and meetings on assigned strategic priorities and report that information, along with recommendations, to the Managing Partner.
  • Oversee the research and preparation of decks and briefing materials on strategic priorities or investor relations matters for upcoming meetings and events, draft event briefings and talking points, and support preparation for internal and external events on behalf of the Managing Partner.
  • Handling inquiries and routine or complex responsibilities as delegated.

Requirements

  • Experience in creative problem-solving and eliminating barriers at any organizational level.
  • Superior analytical and project management capabilities. Proven ability in prioritizing workflows, working independently within tight deadlines, and collaborating across teams with limited supervision.
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects across a wide variety of functional business problems.
  • Clear, effective communicator across written and verbal communication; able to influence and collaborate with stakeholders across functions at all levels of experience.
  • Creativity and comfortable with ‘blank sheet of paper’ assignments. Comfortable with ambiguity and identifying what may be needed to define clarity.
  • Discreet and trustworthy in handling sensitive commercial information and conducting discussions accordingly.

Technical Requirements

  • Strongly proficient in Excel / Sheets and Powerpoint / Slides.
  • Familiarity with CRM and database software.

Education & Experience

  • Strong academic track record, with a degree in Law, Business, Economics or Management.
  • 4-6 years of work experience as a Chief of Staff in an international organization, or work experience in either a top-tier strategy consulting firm or in-house strategy team, a high growth technology startup or venture capital firm, or a top-tier legal firm.

This role is accepting candidates based in Mexico. You must have the right to live and work in the country where you are located.

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Who We Are:

Drip (dripshop.live) is a fast-growing, VC-backed live shopping platform and community for collectibles, hobbyist products, and NFTs. Drip enables collectors to buy, sell, and stream with their engaged communities. We closed in $28.5M Series A and Seed funding at a $100M+ valuation to build our team and power delightful live commerce experiences from lead investors like Base10, Eniac and Kindred Ventures with participation from leading angels and tier-1 VC funds.

Our Values:

  • We are seller first
  • We are customer obsessed
  • Engaged with the community we build for
  • Embrace in radical ownership
  • Value radical candor
  • Strive to be excellent
  • Make the case for optimism

Job Overview:

As the Chief of Staff, you will work cross-functionally at Drip on highly impactful projects ranging from category expansion, and operational to finance to product. This is a highly impactful role that will work on the most pressing strategic initiatives at drip with high visibility.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional projects to scale functions and capabilities
  • Define and measure important KPIs
  • Drive efficiency and transparency in processes
  • Ensure roles and personnel are aligned with objectives
  • Spin-up new initiatives to drive growth

Required Background:

  • Ideally 4 to 6 years of overall work experience
  • Worked in top-tier consulting, banking and/or fast-growing marketplaces
  • Tech start-up experience preferably in eCommerce, marketplaces or content

Benefits:

  • Remote-first company with the opportunity to travel for team meetings and conferences
  • Competitive compensation
  • Competitive equity
  • Drip credits
  • Flexible PTO
  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • 401K, Flexible Spending Account
  • Short and Long term Disability, Basic Life & ADD

Extra Perks:

  • Talk Space Mental health therapy
  • Healthcare Advocate handle medical billing issues, legal advice and financial planning
  • One Medical telehealth primary care services, same day next day
  • Commuter benefits Pre-taxed commuter benefits
  • Teledoc24/7 access to U.S.-licensed doctors

Our Commitment to Inclusive Hiring:

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. In accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We are happy to accommodate any disabilities or special needs

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Who We Are

PushBlack is the nation's largest media advocacy organization for Black Americans, currently serving 9 million people monthly across all platforms. We use the power of narrative, especially Black History, to educate and activate our subscribers to build their personal power and create lasting economic and political change.

In 2021, PushBlack grew to 5.9M subscribers on Facebook Messenger and 500K followers on Instagram. We also ran the nation’s largest GOTV campaign for Black Americans. In May 2020, we launched Black History Year, our critically acclaimed podcast, which has received over 3M downloads. In January 2022, we launched the pilot season of our finance podcast, Building Black Dollars. We’re at 17k downloads already. As we continue building our podcasting network, many more shows that we produce will serve our wide listenership.


What We’re Looking For

We‘re hiring an experienced, motivated, and entrepreneurial driven leader to be our Chief of Staff. The Chief of Staff will report directly to the Chief Executive Officer and will work closely with him to optimize his effectiveness, serving as a thought partner and trusted advisor and will lead the Executive Office team. This role will interface regularly with C-Suite leadership, but will not be a member of the C-Suite or hold operational responsibilities across the entire org. The ideal candidate is someone who is looking to provide strategic and program management support at the executive level. The Chief of Staff will support and manage the implementation of the Chief Executive Officer’s strategic priorities; manage and prioritize the workflow of the Chief Executive Officer's office; advance transparency, accessibility, inclusion, and a mission-centric focus through internal communications and collaboration. The Chief of Staff will also manage engagement with the organization’s Board of Directors and handle highly sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion.



What You’ll Be Doing
  • Serve as a thought partner and strategic advisor to the Chief Executive Officer, especially as it relates to implementing his executive priorities;
  • Develop systems and processes to maximize the Chief Executive Officer’s time and effectiveness;
  • Coordinate efficient, effective cross-organizational collaboration and decision-making to ensure that involvement of the Chief Executive Officer is strategic and occurs at the right time;
  • Develop systems and processes to ensure that the Chief Executive Officer is well-informed of internal activities and external affairs, supporting his critical role in “connecting-the-dots” both internally and externally to support the mission and impact of the organization;
  • Attend meetings with the Chief Executive Officer, ensuring in advance that meeting objectives and agendas are clear and following up on action items and, as appropriate, stand in for Chief Executive Officer as appropriate;
  • Manage the Executive Team meeting agendas, focusing leaders on the Chief Executive Officer’s priorities and objectives for the organization, as well as those issues that cut across functions and programs to serve the organization’s mission and increase impact;
  • Lead and manage projects, including special projects, that require interdepartmental collaboration across the organization’s functional areas;
  • Lead internal communications and develop processes that reliably relay information and solicit feedback in a way that models inclusivity, transparency, efficiency, and accountability; develop and develop a comprehensive calendar of internal communications;
  • Manage engagement with the Board of Directors including, but not limited to, planning regular Board meetings and governance committee meetings; preparing and distributing Board meeting agendas, reports and supporting materials, and oversee communication with Board members to support the Board’s effectiveness;
  • Manage the work of the Executive Office, including the work of executive assistant(s)
  • Lead Executive Office team in setting their own priorities, improvement agenda, and workplan for each quarter

Requirements

Skills + Experience
  • Five to Ten years of demonstrated success in leadership, managerial, problem-solving, strategic planning, and implementation with solid business acumen
  • An avid reader who enjoys learning and applying that knowledge to their work.
  • Demonstrated experience performing research on a wide range of topics and synthesizing findings in a comprehensive but digestible format.
  • A proactive quick study with exceptional judgment as well as interpersonal and project management skills suited for a fast-paced organization.
  • Must have a demonstrated commitment to the organization’s mission and values.
  • An astute observer of organizational dynamics, a sophisticated purveyor of positive organizational culture, a proactive, skilled communicator able to establish and maintain strong relationships and have a zest for collaboration.
This Would Put You Over The Top
  • Demonstrated knowledge of how to use civic engagement and narrative change to advance Black liberation.
  • Experience in nonprofit or private media
  • Understands that this work is in service of the organization and the people who do the work of the organization
  • Familiarity with G-Suite, Slack, Trello, and/or other online productivity tools

Benefits

What We Offer Our Team
  • Whether you love your couch or your desk, it doesn’t matter. We’re 100% Remote!
  • 100% employer paid medical, dental and vision insurances
  • Retirement savings account (401K) with tiered matching contributions
  • Three weeks’ (15 PTO days) paid vacation in the first year of service; four weeks (20 PTO days) in subsequent years. Ten (10) Sick days and 3 Floating Holidays every year.
  • Eight (8) Paid Holidays including Juneteenth, as well as a Winter holiday for the last week of the year
  • Annual taxable work-from-home stipend ($4,800)
  • Annual professional development budget ($1,750 of which $500 can roll over each year)
  • School loan repayment assistance support up to $200 monthly for undergraduate loans or up to $300 for graduate loans
  • Parental Leave during new child’s first year

Let’s Talk About The Salary
  • The salary range for this position is $103,272 - $166,138.

results.title: Pega Lead Business Analyst
results.description:

You will love to join this company for:

  • Competitive package in line with the best market standards
  • Fully remote work 
  • Work-life balance
  • Agile work environment

results.title: Product Safety and Compliance Specialist
results.description:
We’re TeeTurtle, a rapidly growing consumer products company that creates nerdy toys, games, apparel, and accessories. We are passionate about creating products that allow our fans to express themselves and share meaningful experiences.

 

We are looking for an experienced Product Safety and Compliance Specialist to ensure our products meet all domestic and international safety requirements.

 

Job Description:

  • Maintain files for current safety testing reports to ensure all testing remains in compliance with expected standards

  • Establish guidelines and create checklists with the Product Development team for product testing to ensure the correct safety testing is performed for each new item

  • Coordinate with the Product Development and Supply Chain teams to analyze test results and provide recommendations to ensure successful resolution

  • Coordinate with the Creative team to establish guidelines and create checklists of all current product packaging requirements to ensure compliance with all applicable guidelines

  • Coordinate with the Product Development team to proof data files for new products to ensure files are complete and accurate before the sampling process begins

  • Establish guidelines and create checklists of required safety testing documentation (PID, ISO 9001 certifications, etc.) for each of our wholesale partners to ensure accurate and smooth delivery of product

  • Coordinate with our factories and testing labs to clarify product testing, marking, and labeling requirements in order to ensure that all regulatory requirements are met

  • Work with our current testing facilities to negotiate pricing and explore alternative processes such as batch testing or raw material testing in order to improve and reduce unnecessary costs

  • Create SOPs for products and toy safety regulations to guide our team through the complex and often changing regulatory landscape of product testing requirements

  • Other duties as assigned

Core Competencies:

  • Process Orientation

  • Cross-Departmental Collaboration

  • Organization

  • Attention to Detail

  • Flexibility & Adaptability

  • Written Communication

  • Negotiation & Vendor Partnership

 

Qualifications:

  • High School diploma or equivalent (required)

  • 4+ years of safety and compliance experience (required)

  • 3+ years of experience working with toy parts or finished goods exports, compliance, and regulations (preferred)

  • Understanding of worldwide, local, state, and federal product safety standards (preferred)

  • Understanding of ASTM, ISO, and CEN standard development processes (required)

  • Proficiency in Google or Microsoft Office Suite (required)

  • Proficiency in Trello (preferred)

This is a full-time, exempt position that reports to the Supply Chain Manager.

 

 

Salary Range:

$40,000 - $60,000/yr. based on experience, qualifications, and skills

results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
Mod Op is a full-service advertising agency with offices in New York, Los Angeles, Miami, Minneapolis, Portland, Dallas, Kansas City, Cleveland and Panama City, Panama. Thanks to ongoing growth by acquisition directed by our dynamic former-venture-capitalist CEO and our team of industry leaders, Mod Op can offer you a generous time-off package, access to low-cost, high-quality healthcare options, and a team of enthusiastic, collaborative, and motivated coworkers who see career development and personal development as intertwined.

Summary

Mod Op’s Executive Assistant is the communication and organizational hub for Mod Op executives. They provide personalized secretarial and administrative support in a well-organized and timely manner and will work on a one-to-one basis on a variety of tasks related to executive’s working life and communication. Mod Op Executive Assistants are detail-oriented, have a “can-do” attitude, and are eager to learn new things. They are tasked with problem-solving, coordinating details, organizing materials, anticipating requests, linking teams, and mastering tools to provide financial, logistical, and operational information across offices and departments.

Essential Functions

Administrative

• Act as the point of contact between the executive and internal/external clients

• Maintain calendar, arrange meetings and appointments, and provide reminders

• Plan meetings and take detailed notes

• Write and organize emails, memos, letters, and forms

• Develop and maintain a filing system (Box, SharePoint, OneDrive, etc.)

• Maintain contact lists

• Book travel arrangements

• Submit and reconcile expense reports (NetSuite)

• Liaise with teams to handle requests and queries

Client Outreach Support

• New business outreach support: emailing existing database using templates

• Data mining/research on LinkedIn for connections and opportunities

• Email sorting / prioritizing

• Managing new business CRM status and priorities

Travel

This position requires up to 0% travel.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position has no supervisory responsibility.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

Office hours are 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM Monday thru Friday.

Requirements

Required Education and Experience

• Must live and be legally able to work in Panama, Republic of Panama

High-level proficiency in MS365 Word, Excel, and Outlook

• High-level proficiency in written and spoken English

• Experience with CRM software preferred

• 2-3 years experience as an Executive Admin Assistant, Senior Exec Asst or other secretarial role

• Proven experience in an executive administrative or support role that includes expense reporting, travel arrangement, correspondence, and calendaring

• Professional written and spoken communication skills

• Professional discretion and confidentiality

• Exemplary time management skills

• Interest/ability to learn new platforms and skills

• BA degree or equivalent working experience

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Benefits

  • Health and Life Insurance for employee and family, access to Vision benefits, Telemedicine services, Psychology support and others.
  • On-the-job training and career growth opportunities
  • Fully remote job
  • Great team environment, collaborative offices, fun company culture with a great balance of work and play
  • Vacations are granted by day or weeks according to employee approved request.
  • Salary with yearly review and competitive benefits
  • Pay commensurate and competitive based on experience and skill set.

 

When asked what they love about working at Mod Op, we hear:

  • “I feel I can be myself at work and it’s fun!” -MV
  • “The caliber of the clients/brands we work with, knowing your work is seen by thousands of people, in many cases across the world.” -JC
  • “We actually create videogames!” -AC
  • “We have an all-star team, and it’s like playing in the pro-bowl every day!” -MW
  • “Opportunities to always learn from and work with the best and the brightest.” HW
  • “Mentors and opportunities for growth.” -KB

 

Mod Op believes in teamwork, client collaboration, powerful storytelling, stunning design, and thoughtful problem-solving. Our clients represent a breadth of industries, and every project presents new and interesting challenges. We would love for you to join us!
